HiddenText.Name: Effectiveness
HiddenText.OpenningText: How can group be as effective as individual therapy since I will have to share the time with others?
HiddenText.BodyCopy: Actually, group therapy is often more efficient than individual therapy for two reasons. First, you can benefit from the group by listening carefully to toerhs and their experiences. You will find that you have much in common with other group members, and, as they work on a concern, you can learn more about yourself. Secondly, group members will often bring up issues that strike a chord with you, but that you might not have been aware of or brought up yourself.
